meanings.definition: The state or quality of being weak or lacking strength.
meanings.sent1: Her weakliness was evident when she struggled to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: The kitten's weakliness made it difficult for him to climb the stairs.
meanings.sent3: Despite his weakliness, he always tried his best in everything he did.
meanings.sent4: The weakliness of the old bridge was a cause for concern among the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The weakliness of the plant's stems made it bend easily in the wind.

meanings.definition: A weakness or vulnerability in character or ability.
meanings.sent1: His weakliness in resisting temptation often led him astray.
meanings.sent2: She acknowledged her weakliness in public speaking and worked to improve it.
meanings.sent3: His weakliness for chocolate was well-known among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The team's weakliness in defense cost them the game.
meanings.sent5: The weakliness in his argument was exposed during the debate.
